alert.note: Alert for Elkhart; St. Joseph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 9:26PM EST until February 01 at 7:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...Michigan... Tippecanoe River near Ora affecting Pulaski, Kosciusko, Fulton IN, Marshall and Starke Counties. Saint Joseph River Michigan at South Bend affecting Berrien, Elkhart and St. Joseph Counties. Saint Joseph River Michigan at Three Rivers affecting Elkhart, Branch and St. Joseph MI Counties. .Recent snow melt and continued rainfall will lead to rises on area rivers. For the Tippecanoe River...including Ora, Winamac, Norway Dam... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Saint Joseph River Michigan...including Three Rivers, Mottville, Elkhart IN, South Bend, Niles...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING TO THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saint Joseph River Michigan at South Bend. * WHEN...From Sunday morning to Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding is confined to mostly park land and golf courses. Leeper Park and Petro golf courses begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EST Saturday the stage was 5.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 5.8 feet Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 330 PM EST /230 PM CST/.
